result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates

records.addlTxt: for Recompense

10:12 AM Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court for Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates.  Attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Jim Larson appeared by video - S&T.  J.G.P.G. appeared by video.  Court notes the parties do not object to the request found in the motion for recompense.  Atty Martinez advises he spoke with the surety as well and the surety did not object to the State's motion.  Court makes no finding on the restitution amount event though a Stipulation has been provided to the Court but on the stipulations put on the record, the Court grants the motion for recompense in the amount of $15,000.

Zoom Instructions
Motion hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
for Recompense
of Restitution

1:30 PM Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates not in court.  Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court for Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests bond be forfeited.  State plans to file a motion to recompense if bond is forfeited.  Atty Martinez requests bond be returned to the surety.  Court forfeits cash bond but the money is to be held until further order from the Court.
Body

1:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates not in court.  Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court for Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates.  Atty Martinez has no record to make.  State requests a warrant and bond forfeiture to commence.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and bond forfeiture proceedings to commence.
Return date on August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
from Atty Martinez to Br 3

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates appeared by video/audio zoom.  Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court for Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates.  Interpreter Fred S (sworn) also appears by video/audio zoom.  Victim (JEGP) also appears by audio only.  Court calls case and states appearances.  Today's hearing is to address a bail modification motion.  State notes the victim wished to speak on that issue.  Court asks the victim to state his name and speak slowly so the interpreter can interpreter for the Court.  The victim states he cannot hear the Court via a chat w/the interpreter.  Interpreter offers to read chat messages from victim if the Court wishes.  State would also be willing to speak on behalf of the victim.  Victim states he would like the bond to remain as is.  State also would like the bond to continue and would object to the green card being returned but wouldn't object to the DE being provided a copy.  Atty Martinez responds - notes ID card can be returned as he understands it.  Court notes she did review the documents surrendered by the DE that are being kept in the COC's office.  Court agrees she did not ask for the DE's Mexico ID and grants the request for return of those cards to the DE.  The Court declines to return the green card at this time.  Court declines to provide a photo copy of the document as the Court is not familiar enough w/immigration issues that might be raised by having a photo copy rather than the original.  Court also declines to modify the amount of the cash bond at this time.  RD was already set in this matter and NOH was previously provided to the DE.  Cards in question to be surrendered to Atty Martinez and he will return those to the DE.  Nothing further.  Court is adjourned.

No contact w/J.E.G.P..  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No alcohol of any kind.  No possession of any alcohol and no presence in any bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is the sale of alcohol.  No personal possession of any dangerous weapon.  DE must submit all documentation possessed by the DE that would allow him to cross international borders.
Zoom Instructions

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates in court.  Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court for Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates.  Interpreter, Ruth Garcia - S&T by telephone.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Court grants the request to continue today's hearing and finds DE's waiver of time limits to be freely and voluntarily made.  Bond continues.  Victim notification was made for today's proceedings.
Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Acknowledgment by Person Posting Bail/Deposit

2:50 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan I. Estrada Turrubiates appeared by video, in custody with atty Andrew Martinez and interpreter Alejandra K (sworn) appears in person from the courtroom.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Martinez will be representing the DE.  State requests special conditions and $25,000 cash bond.  Atty Martinez responds - agrees to the conditions requested but does request lesser cash bond than the State asked for - possibly $2,500.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing but Atty Martinez does think after talking to the DE they may be waiving the prelim itself.  $15,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/J.E.G.P..  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No alcohol of any kind.  No possession of any alcohol and no presence in any bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is the sale of alcohol.  No personal possession of any dangerous weapon.  DE must submit all documentation possessed by the DE that would allow him to cross international borders.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
